ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Patch Message / worshipping
ygData.msgSnippet: Before you read this just keep in mind im just curious as to why worship, sure i understand that some stuff should be wieldable by deity specific characters,
ygData.messageBody:
Before you read this just keep in mind im just curious as to why worship,
sure i understand that some stuff should be wieldable by deity specific
characters, but also keep in mind that they also should keep the balance for
the agnostic people in the world. I chose agnostic for many reasons, i find
i am more accepted in different towns because of this, not much but still it
helps. I like the idea of deity specific stuff but i *hope* that they will
not favor certain deities and have deity specific stuff for each deity as
well as unholy items for us agnostics.

On another note...

Why worship. This reminds me of an old pun advertisement i read somewhere...

honda in the 70's had an add that was something like :
follow us we're riding hondas

then a mile down the road harley had an add:
Ride a harley, don't follow anyone...

It says it all, i know i've gone off topic abit but i personally don't like
following something i've never seen... Why put my faith into something that
does not manifest its presence in the world? While all you worshippers are
spending time in the temples worshipping a god that somewhere someone is
camping, i'll be having a beer at the tavern with my friends 8) When ya
think about it, why are people worshipping a god? gods are gods, they cant
be killed by a group of people, doesnt make sense in my book.

Oh and ya some of the gods do have a presence in the world... but think
about it, my necro follows innoruk, and i have to kill my god to get the pet
enhancing book. I guess i'm agnostic after all. Either that or when i go
buy my next coffin in innoruk's temple i'll probably burn up on entry or
something.

Rakka 49 necro follower of Innoruk *cough*
Minkin 36 bard Agnostic
Tanqueray 6 warrior Agnostic



> -----Original Message-----
> From: Mike Roach [SMTP:Mike.Roach@...]
> Sent: Tuesday, April 11, 2000 3:51 PM
> To: 'eqbards@egroups.com'
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] Patch Message
>
> Is it just me or does this part concern anyone a bit:
>
> "Items have gained the ability to be restricted by Deity. If a deity
> restriction is placed upon an item, it will show when you
> right-click-and-hold on the item."
>
> I chose Tunare as my deity so many moons ago when I started Faras (April
> 11,
> 1999 - today is my one year anniversary in EQ) because I wanted to RP a
> tree-hugging nature bard type, the mother of all and so forth. There have
> been times I wished I had chosen Bristlebane but I still think Tunare
> better
> goes with how I play than Bristlebane does.
>
> At any rate, I wonder what weapons I have that the Momma of All might
> suddenly find unnaceptable...nothing like a hen-pecking mother to spoil
> the
> fun.
>
> -Faras
>
